explanation: The root **graph** comes from the Greek word *graphein*, meaning 'to write' or 'to draw'. It is found in many English words related to writing, drawing, recording, or representing visually.
level_note: This root is commonly found in words ranging from B1 to C1 CEFR levels.

parts.meaning: viết, vẽ, ghi lại (write, draw, record)

words.logic: photo- (ánh sáng) + graph (vẽ, ghi lại) = hành động vẽ hoặc ghi lại hình ảnh bằng ánh sáng.
words.meaning_en: A picture made using a camera, especially with a chemical process.
words.example: She took a beautiful photograph of the sunset.

collocations.example: We took many photographs on our trip.
I found an old photograph of my grandparents in the album.
Most people prefer to store digital photographs on their computers.

forms.example: The photographer captured the perfect moment.
He has a passion for wildlife photography.
The museum exhibits a collection of photographic prints.

words.logic: auto- (tự) + graph (viết) = chữ viết của chính bản thân người đó.
words.meaning_en: A signature, especially that of a celebrity, written as a memento for an admirer.
words.example: Fans waited for hours to get the singer's autograph.

collocations.example: The actor stopped to sign an autograph for a young fan.
My dream is to get an autograph from my favorite author.
Some people enjoy collecting autographs as a hobby.

forms.example: He autographed a copy of his new book for me.

words.logic: para- (bên cạnh) + graph (viết) = một phần chữ viết được đánh dấu hoặc tách ra ở bên cạnh (thường bằng cách thụt vào đầu dòng).
words.meaning_en: A distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme and indicated by a new line, indentation, or numbering.
words.example: The essay should have at least three paragraphs.

collocations.example: Read the first paragraph carefully to understand the main idea.
Start a new paragraph when you change topics in your essay.
The introductory paragraph sets the stage for the entire report.

words.logic: graph (vẽ, thể hiện) + -ic (thuộc về) = thuộc về việc vẽ, thể hiện bằng hình ảnh; hoặc sống động, rõ ràng như được vẽ ra trước mắt.
words.meaning_vi: đồ họa; sống động, rõ ràng
words.meaning_en: Relating to visual art, especially drawing or engraving; giving clear and vivid details.
words.example: The movie contained some graphic scenes of violence.

collocations.example: She studied graphic design at university and now works as a web designer.
The news report provided graphic details of the accident.
Many young people enjoy reading graphic novels, which are like long comic books.

forms.example: The computer game has excellent graphics.
He described the events graphically, making everyone feel as if they were there.

parts.meaning: hậu tố tạo danh từ (noun suffix)

words.logic: bio- (sự sống, cuộc đời) + graph (viết) + -y (danh từ) = một tác phẩm viết về cuộc đời của ai đó.
words.meaning_en: An account of someone's life written by someone else.
words.example: I'm currently reading a fascinating biography of Steve Jobs.

collocations.example: He spent years researching to write a biography of the famous explorer.
This is the authorized biography of the Queen, giving an official account of her life.
She enjoys reading historical biographies to learn about past figures.

forms.example: The biographer interviewed hundreds of people for his book.
The film is based on biographical events from her early life.

words.logic: tele- (xa) + graph (viết, ghi lại) = thiết bị dùng để viết hoặc gửi thông điệp từ xa.
words.meaning_vi: máy điện báo; điện báo (tin nhắn)
words.meaning_en: An apparatus for sending messages over a distance by converting electric impulses into signals.
words.example: In the past, people sent important messages by telegraph.

collocations.example: My grandparents used to send a telegraph to communicate urgent news.
Before phones, people would go to the telegraph office to send messages.
The telegraph service was crucial for international communication in the 19th century.

forms.example: They telegraphed the news of their safe arrival to their relatives.
He sent a short, telegraphic message.

memory_logic.meaning: viết, vẽ, ghi lại (write, draw, record)
